posts.post_content: This guy is so relentless. He's so easy to get into play too. Once he's on the board, your opponent better have something to block with. Sure, you can only swing with him 3 times, but I think you'll find that you won't need to swing with him more than 3 times, especially if you can lay down a second one. I can play a [Terra Stomper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terra Stomper) with my green deck on turn 3, but honestly, I'd rather play this. Blastoderm can't be terrored, unlike Terra Stomper. Turn 1, Forest -> [Wild Growth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wild Growth). Turn 2, Forest -> [Arbor Elf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arbor Elf)-> [Instill energy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Instill energy) -> Blastoderm. Even if they've got a [Force Spike](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Force Spike) or a [Daze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Daze), you've still got 1 mana to spare! BAM!!! Turn 3, Terra Stomper. At that point, even a hard counter won't help them. Blastoderm is also especially sweet with cards like [Call of the Wild](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Call of the Wild), [Sylvan Library](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sylvan Library), and [Worldly Tutor/au](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Worldly Tutor/au)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Opeth2010 (1/14/2012 4:02:34 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
At the beginning of its 4th upkeep, when it has no more fade counters to remove and has to be then sacrificed... can you return him to your hand via [Stampeding Wildebeests](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stampeding Wildebeests)? I know he has Shroud, but he's not being targeted so that's not my concern. The issue is both of these actions occur simultaneously at the beginning of the upkeep.  
  
4 CMC for a 5/5 Shroud is an awesome deal! Have to get rid of him in 3 turns but some creatures don't last that long anyway, besides by the time he goes (unless you use the DD theme to save him) he's done his damage... good creature.
posts.html:

I know he has Shroud, but he's not being targeted so that's not my concern. The issue is both of these actions occur simultaneously at the beginning of the upkeep.

4 CMC for a 5/5 Shroud is an awesome deal! Have to get rid of him in 3 turns but some creatures don't last that long anyway, besides by the time he goes (unless you use the DD theme to save him) he's done his damage... good creature.

posts.post_content: @ AXER: Yes, yes you can. Same as you can sacrifice him to [Ravenous Baloth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ravenous Baloth) or trade for something using [Contested Cliffs](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Contested Cliffs) during the final upkeep he's in play too. You technically play all the abilities at the same time, but you get to choose which order they stack in.

posts.post_content:
Is there some rule that all of the new art for beasts has to make them look stupid? Look at that face! Deeeerp. Glad I already have a playset of the old Blastoderm. It looks vicious. This just looks like an ox with tusks.  
  
As always, great with global effects like [Primal Rage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Primal Rage) to get around the shroud or with sacrifice outlets like [Ravenous Baloth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ravenous Baloth) to get extra use out of it before it dies to fading.
